numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The comment refers to a graph.
2. A family can have a higher income or a lower income.
3. If a family has a higher income then the likelihood of getting accepted into college is higher.
4. If a family has a lower income then the likelihood of getting accepted into college is lower.
5. An applicant can be a legacy applicant or a non-legacy applicant.
6. A legacy applicant has up to 7 times the chance of getting accepted into college.
7. A non-legacy applicant has about 2 times the chance of getting accepted into college.
8. The author wonders why colleges favor higher-income applicants.
9. The author thinks that low-income applicants should have equal chances.
10. Higher-income applicants and low-income applicants pay a similar amount of money at college.
11. The author thinks that applicants are similar at an academic level.
12. The author says that this issue relates to the author and the author's community.
13. Many people in the author's town come from different countries.
14. Some families in the author's town do not have a high income.
15. The author says that every applicant should have an equal probability of getting accepted into any college.
16. The author says that colleges should worry only about the grades of applicants.
17. The headline is: Is the education system really fair?
